meanings.definition: The crust of potassium bitartrate left in wine casks.
meanings.sent1: The winemaker scraped off the argol from the cask.
meanings.sent2: The argol in the wine cask indicated its age.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous mouse used the argol to decorate its tiny house.
meanings.sent4: The argol clinging to the cask was like a stubborn memory refusing to fade.
meanings.sent5: As the sunlight hit the argol, it sparkled like a miniature diamond mine.

meanings.definition: A deposit of tartar in wine casks.
meanings.sent1: The argol was carefully removed to ensure the purity of the wine.
meanings.sent2: The winery had to clean out the argol regularly to maintain quality.
meanings.sent3: The chef mistakenly used argol instead of sugar in the recipe, resulting in a bitter dish.
meanings.sent4: The argol in the cask seemed to whisper tales of the vineyard's history.
meanings.sent5: The argol clung to the cask like a secret waiting to be discovered.

meanings.definition: A white crystalline deposit that forms on the insides of wine casks.
meanings.sent1: The argol glistened in the dimly lit cellar.
meanings.sent2: The winemaker inspected the argol to assess the quality of the wine.
meanings.sent3: The argol in the cask played hide-and-seek with the curious cat.
meanings.sent4: The argol resembled tiny snowflakes trapped in the wood.
meanings.sent5: The cellar was filled with the delicate scent of aging wine and argol.
